intro: Lysionotus metuoensis, commonly known as the Metuo mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are usually broad and oval, with a hairy texture that helps protect it from harsh weather conditions. Lysionotus metuoensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its ecological niche.
